problem_text: All Romance languages are Indo-European languages. The Romance languages are a language family. All languages within a language family are related to each other. French and Spanish are both Romance languages. German is related to Spanish. Basque is not related to any other language.
predicates:
RomanceLanguage(x) ::: x is a Romance language.
IndoEuropeanLanguage(x) ::: x is an Indo-European language.
LanguageFamily(x) ::: x is a language family.
Related(x, y) ::: x is related to y.
Language(x) ::: x is a language.
BelongsToFamily(x, y) ::: language x belongs to language family y.
French(x) ::: x is French.
Spanish(x) ::: x is Spanish.
German(x) ::: x is German.
Basque(x) ::: x is Basque.

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Basque is a Romance language.
tests.conclusions: RomanceLanguage(basque) ::: Basque is a Romance language. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? French and German are related.
tests.conclusions: Related(french, german) ::: French and German are related. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? All languages that belong to the Romance language family are related to French.
tests.conclusions: ∀x (BelongsToFamily(x, romancelanguages) → Related(x, french)) ::: All languages that belong to the Romance language family are related to French. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? German is a Romance language.
tests.conclusions: German(german) → RomanceLanguage(german) ::: German is a Romance language. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Basque is a language family.
tests.conclusions: LanguageFamily(basque) ::: Basque is a language family. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? German is a Romance language and is related to Basque.
tests.conclusions: German(german) ∧ Related(german, basque) ::: German is a Romance language and is related to Basque. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Spanish and German are related.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Basque is an Indo-European language.
tests.conclusions: IndoEuropeanLanguage(basque) ::: Basque is an Indo-European language. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? All Romance languages are related to Spanish.
tests.conclusions: ∀x (RomanceLanguage(x) → Related(x, spanish)) ::: All Romance languages are related to Spanish. TRUE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Basque is related to French.

candidate_solutions.text:
# Predicates:
RomanceLanguage(x) ::: x is a Romance language.
IndoEuropeanLanguage(x) ::: x is an Indo-European language.
LanguageFamily(x) ::: x is a language family.
Related(x, y) ::: x is related to y.
Language(x) ::: x is a language.
BelongsToFamily(x, y) ::: language x belongs to language family y.
French(x) ::: x is French.
Spanish(x) ::: x is Spanish.
German(x) ::: x is German.
Basque(x) ::: x is Basque.

# Premises:
∀x (RomanceLanguage(x) → IndoEuropeanLanguage(x)) ::: All Romance languages are Indo-European languages.
∀x (RomanceLanguage(x) → BelongsToFamily(x, romance)) ::: The Romance languages are a language family.
∀x ∀y (BelongsToFamily(x, y) ∧ BelongsToFamily(z, y) → Related(x, z)) ::: All languages within a language family are related to each other.
RomanceLanguage(french) ∧ RomanceLanguage(spanish) ::: French and Spanish are both Romance languages.
Related(german, spanish) ::: German is related to Spanish.
∀x (Basque(x) → ¬∃y (Related(x, y) ∧ ¬(x = y))) ::: Basque is not related to any other language.

# Predicates:
RomanceLanguage(x) ::: x is a Romance language.
IndoEuropeanLanguage(x) ::: x is an Indo-European language.
LanguageFamily(x) ::: x is a language family.
Related(x, y) ::: x is related to y.
Language(x) ::: x is a language.
BelongsToFamily(x, y) ::: language x belongs to language family y.
French(x) ::: x is French.
Spanish(x) ::: x is Spanish.
German(x) ::: x is German.
Basque(x) ::: x is Basque.

# Premises:
∀x (RomanceLanguage(x) → IndoEuropeanLanguage(x)) ::: All Romance languages are Indo-European languages.
∀x (RomanceLanguage(x) → LanguageFamily(romance)) ::: The Romance languages are a language family.
∀x ∀y ∀z (Language(x) ∧ Language(y) ∧ BelongsToFamily(x, z) ∧ BelongsToFamily(y, z) → Related(x, y)) ::: All languages within a language family are related to each other.
RomanceLanguage(french) ∧ RomanceLanguage(spanish) ::: French and Spanish are both Romance languages.
Related(german, spanish) ::: German is related to Spanish.
∀x (Basque(x) → ∀y (Language(y) → ¬Related(x, y) ∨ x = y)) ::: Basque is not related to any other language.

∀x ∀y ∀z (BelongsToFamily(x, z) ∧ BelongsToFamily(y, z) → Related(x, y)) ::: All languages within a language family are related to each other.
RomanceLanguage(french) ∧ RomanceLanguage(spanish) ::: French and Spanish are both Romance languages.
Related(german, spanish) ::: German is related to Spanish.
∀x (Basque(x) → ∀y (Language(y) → ¬Related(x, y) ∨ x = y)) ::: Basque is not related to any other language.
